message: Make sure that the current user is always recorded as a top-level attribute in the HTTP Session (for access by templates)
Release version 9.1.1
Start next development version 9.1.2-SNAPSHOT

Add ability to edit Session endpoints (owner or admin)
Add ability to assign roles on creating a user (when an admin)
Add session-scoped nonces to edit forms for CSRF protection
Remove sample-rest-service (example of how to build a framework application is now available in the config service and user manager)
Fix scan.packages shipped in configuration service so it will correctly scan the config service API interface now it's moved to guice-common
Release version 9.1.0
Start next development version 9.1.1-SNAPSHOT
Remove System.out.println statements
Remove all System.out.println statements
Bugfix: services weren't being listed on the services page

Add client-side support for OAuth2 under the User Manager (can add other OAuth implementations but would need a way to retrieve role/group information from them).
Adds:
 - Client state nonce support so that a user will be notified if a third party initiates the oauth auth flow (in this case a session will exist with an Authorisation Code but no Authorisation Token)
 - Client will automatically use the refresh token to get an updated Authorisation Token when it expires
 - Client will automatically redirect to the OAuth provider on the first auth constraint requiring authentication

Server:
 - Security enhancement to make sure that only registered endpoints can be used (previously allowed endpoints starting with one of the registered strings, however this can be an issue if the service has an endpoint which could be used to redirect elsewhere)
 - Various improvements / fixes to the template for the Allow/Deny access screen

Initial commit of OAuth2 API for the user manager, adds oauth2 clients (called services by the user manager) to the database, as well as service connections (session contexts in the database) and sessions.

By coming in through an oauth2 API users can get the user to interactively create a service connection (the initial grant of basic access to user info to a service the first time a user accesses some service) and then automatically create sessions and be directed back to the calling application.

Basic groundwork for client-side oauth2 logic (we register a callback service and will additionally require a custom user provider to be built so that we can perform the initial redirect of the user).
Remove AzureLogAppender dependency
Initial commit of user manager, a very simple user+role database
Use the webapp path when setting JWT cookie
Release version 9.0.1
Start next development version 9.0.2-SNAPSHOT

Improve the clarity of exceptions produced by JAXBSerialiser by looking inside JAXBException and trying to extract a more meaningful cause message (usually JAXBException.getMessage returns null and the exception is just a wrapper for the underlying type)

Update to HTTPClient 4.5 to get a bugfix for HTTPCLIENT-1613 (prevented certain sites from responding to HTTPS requests with wildcard certs just because of their registration in the Mozilla Public Suffix List to prevent setting cookies at certain levels)
When loading configuration, preload with the system environment variables
Add explicit jax-rs client provider for ConfigRestService so that scan.packages doesn't have to include ConfigRestService
Improve documentation on what's involved in the guice startup process
Release version 9.0.0
Start next development version 9.0.1-SNAPSHOT
